one-pass compilation of arithmetic expressions for a parallel processorunder the assumption that a processor may havea multiplicity of arithmetic units a compiler for such a processor should produce object code to takeadvantage of possible parallelism of operation most of the presently known compilation techniquesare inadequate for such a processor because they produce expression structures that must be evaluated serially a technique is presented here for compiling arithmetic expressions into structures that can beevaluated with a high degree of parallelism the algorithm is a variant of the so-called top-down"analysis technique and requires only one pass of the input text.cacm april 1967stone h s.ca670402 jb february 28 1978 11:36 am1086 4 16131132 4 16131234 4 16131263 4 16131265 4
